cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 80 mi (125 km) E of Chetumal, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north later today, then moving north-northeast across the Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle before sweeping NE across the southeastern U.S. and exiting off the mid-Atlantic coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A (current watches confined to Yucatan and western Cuba)
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A (current warnings confined to Yucatan Channel and western Cuba)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle eastward through Georgia and the Carolinas, then Mid-Atlantic coast including Delaware and New Jersey
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts 25–35 mph late Thu as the weakening system passes nearby
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Delaware Bay from this system
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Thu–early Fri with totals generally 2–4 in; localized flooding in poor-drainage areas possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reduced visibility and minor river rises could disrupt cargo handling and ground transport
